Sentence: On the trip south to the capital, called King's Landing, Robert's and Cersei's son, Joffrey, and Ned's daughter Sansa, who everyone presumes will be married one day, go for a walk
When Joffrey sees Arya, Ned's other daughter and sister to Sansa, practicing her (sister) swordfighting with a boy, he (Ned) decides to show them he (Ned)'s a better fighter
Though Sansa knows Joffrey instigated the fight, she (sister) will not tell on Joffrey because she (sister)'s in love with him (wolf)
As punishment, Cersei wants Arya's wolf killed, but since it ran away after hurting Joffrey, Cersei demands that Ned kill Sansa's wolf instead
In the hopes that he (King) can prevent his (King) daughters being harmed, Ned confesses publicly to treason, and Joffrey has him (Ned) executed while Sansa watches
